title: Hijab flashpoints across India: Classrooms to courtrooms; faith vs uniformity

They highlight the ongoing tension between individual rights and uniform policies, with parents, educators, and authorities responding differently in each instance.

description: Russian ambassador Denis Alipov on Thursday stated that India's oil import decisions are driven by its national interests, responding to claims by US President Donald Trump. New Delhi has reaffirmed its independent energy sourcing approach, emphasising the importance of Russian oil for its economy and consumer welfare amidst global volatility.

Veteran singer Balasaraswathi Devi passes away at 97, tributes pour in
description: Veteran actress and playback singer R. Balasaraswathi Devi, a pioneer in Telugu cinema, has passed away at 97. Her career, spanning over 2,000 songs and significant contributions to classical music in films, left an indelible mark. Leaders, including Telangana CM Revanth Reddy and Andhra Pradesh Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan, mourned her loss, acknowledging her irreplaceable contribution to the arts.

title: ‘Hurt by situation’: Ex-Pak PM Imran Khan seeks parole to mediate Afghanistan tensions
description: Imran Khan, currently imprisoned, has reportedly sought parole to mediate escalating border tensions between Pakistan and Taliban-controlled Afghanistan. His sister revealed his deep concern over recent clashes and his offer to facilitate peaceful negotiations. The former PM faces multiple charges while violence flares along the Durand Line, causing casualties and territorial disputes.

title: TV actress placed under ‘digital arrest’ for 7 hours by cyber fraudsters, loses Rs 6.5 lakh
From job offer to battlefield: Hyderabad man lured to Russia; forced to fight against Ukraine
description: A 37-year-old Hyderabad man, Mohammed Ahmed, was allegedly defrauded by a job agent and sent to Russia, where he was reportedly drafted into fighting the war against Ukraine. After jumping from an army vehicle to evade combat and injuring his leg, he is now being threatened to fight or face death.

title: When SNL's Colin Jost 'turned up' in Epstein video with Donald Trump
description: During Saturday Night Live's "Weekend Update," Michael Che used OpenAI's Sora to insert Colin Jost into a 1992 video of Donald Trump and Jeffrey Epstein. The doctored footage showed Jost dancing at the party, much to his visible discomfort and the audience's amusement. This stunt highlights AI's growing role in satire, blurring lines between reality and fabrication.

description: IRCTC's Vikalp feature, or Alternate Train Accommodation Scheme, offers a solution for passengers with waitlisted tickets. This free opt-in service automatically shifts eligible passengers to confirmed seats on alternate trains departing within 12 hours on the same route. Passengers must remember that modifications are not allowed once reassigned, and cancellation charges apply to confirmed Vikalp tickets.

Stubble burning's contribution to PM2.5 is expected to rise, accelerating deterioration. Noida breached the 'very poor' mark, recording the country's worst AQI for the day.

‘Anaesthesia of death’: How Bengaluru doctor’s 'cure' killed his dermatologist wife
description: A Bengaluru surgeon stands accused of murdering his wife, a dermatologist, by administering a fatal anaesthetic overdose. Initially ruled an unnatural death, an autopsy report confirmed the presence of Propofol, transforming the case into a cold-blooded murder investigation. The accused allegedly attempted to conceal his wife's death and prevent an autopsy.

title: IAS officer suicide case: 8-day impasse ends, daughters cremate ADGP Puran Kumar
description: Eight days after IPS officer Y Puran Kumar's death, his family consented to a postmortem following assurances of a fair probe. His daughters performed the last rites. Meanwhile, ASI Sandeep, who investigated Kumar, also died by suicide. His family demanded an FIR before agreeing to an autopsy, receiving assurances from the Haryana CM.

title: Dramatic twist: In ASI suicide case, FIR names IPS officer's wife
description: Rohtak police registered an FIR for abetment to suicide and criminal conspiracy against four individuals, including the wife and brother-in-law of deceased IPS officer Y Puran Kumar, following ASI Sandeep Kumar Lather's suicide. Lather accused Kumar of corruption in a final video before his death. The FIR was lodged after Haryana CM Nayab Singh Saini assured justice to Lather's family.

title: MP shocker: Man shoots, beheads cousin over 'affair' with his wife
description: A shocking incident unfolded in Sagar district where a 28-year-old man was brutally murdered and beheaded by his cousin and family. Suspecting an illicit affair, the attackers allegedly shot and then dismembered the victim. The victim's brother was also shot while attempting to intervene and is in critical condition.

title: Charlie Kirk sculpture showing Jesus embracing him trolled
description: Ave Maria University will soon feature a new sculpture of Jesus Christ embracing conservative activist Charlie Kirk, inspired by his recent death. Canadian artist Timothy Schmalz created the piece, which is expected to join the university's permanent collection next year.

title: Introspection mode: Zoho founder to take break; warns of this risk
description: Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu is stepping back from external commitments to focus on coding, a move driven by his principle of practicing what he preaches. He aims to complete crucial product development, including end-to-end encryption for Zoho's Arattai messaging app, a feature designed to enhance user data privacy by storing information solely on devices.

title: Diwali 2025: Festival calendar, dates, significance and muhurat guide
description: Diwali, the festival of lights, symbolizes the victory of good over evil and knowledge over ignorance. Celebrated over five days starting October 18, 2025, it honors Lord Rama's return and Goddess Lakshmi's blessings. The main Lakshmi Puja occurs on October 20, with specific auspicious timings for prayers.
